      • center

        public static void center(java.awt.Component c)

      • setSizes

        public static java.awt.Component setSizes(java.awt.Component c,
                                          java.awt.Dimension d)
        Sets the boundary sizes of a component, so that layouts which respect these sizes will display them properly. This was created just to save lines of code in places where it would be used often on multiple components.
        Parameters:
        c - component to size
        d - dimension to size the given component to
        Returns:
        The passed in component

      • deriveDimension

        public static java.awt.Dimension deriveDimension(java.awt.Dimension d,
                                                 int dif)
        Derives a dimension from an existing dimension
        Parameters:
        d - Input dimension
        dif - amount to add to existing dimension (can be negative)
        Returns:
        new dimension created by adding the difference to the given dimension

        d - Dimension to size the space to

      • setFontStyle

        public static void setFontStyle(java.awt.Component c,
                                int size,
                                int style)
        Allows the font size and style to be modified for an existing component. Primarily this is used for taking an existing font and enlarging the font or making it bold but not having to actually create a new font and lookup a valid font title.
        Parameters:
        c - Component to change the font on
        size - Size of the new font
        style - Style of the new font

      • deriveFont

        public static java.awt.Font deriveFont(java.awt.Component c,
                                       int size,
                                       int style)
        Derive a font from the given component with the size and style settings given
        Parameters:
        c - Component to change the font on
        size - Size of the new font
        style - Style of the new font
        Returns:
        The newly derived font

      • centerV

        public static void centerV(javax.swing.JPanel panel,
                           java.awt.Component... components)
        Centers the given components on the provided panel, by adding them to an intermediate panel and adding glue above and below them.
        Parameters:
        panel - Panel to add components to
        components - Components to add (can be a single laid out and constructed JPanel)

      • centerH

        public static void centerH(javax.swing.JPanel panel,
                           java.awt.Component... components)
        Centers the given components on the provided panel, by adding them to an intermediate panel and adding glue to the left and the right of them.
        Parameters:
        panel - Panel to add components to
        components - Components to add (can be a single laid out and constructed JPanel)

        public static javax.swing.JPanel createHPanel(javax.swing.JPanel panel,

      • createVPanel

        public static javax.swing.JPanel createVPanel(javax.swing.JPanel panel,
                                              java.awt.Component... components)

      • createHPanel

        public static javax.swing.JPanel createHPanel(javax.swing.JPanel panel,
                                              java.awt.Dimension spacer,
                                              java.awt.Dimension field,
                                              java.awt.Component... components)
        Creates a new horizontally laid out panel with the components supplied, at the field dimension given, with empty spaces the size of the spacer dimension in between each. Saves quite a bit of layout code for creating a panel style that occurs all too often.
        Parameters:
        panel - Panel to add this newly create panel to
        spacer - Dimension of null space between each component laid out
        field - Size to set all components to
        components - Set of all components to add in order
        Returns:
        The newly created JPanel

      • createVPanel

        public static javax.swing.JPanel createVPanel(javax.swing.JPanel panel,
                                              java.awt.Dimension spacer,
                                              java.awt.Dimension field,
                                              java.awt.Component... components)
        Creates a new vertically laid out panel with the components supplied, at the field dimension given, with empty spaces the size of the spacer dimension in between each. Saves quite a bit of layout code for creating a panel style that occurs all too often.
        Parameters:
        panel - Panel to add this newly create panel to
        spacer - Dimension of null space between each component laid out
        field - Size to set all components to
        components - Set of all components to add in order
        Returns:
        The newly created JPanel

      • createHPanel

        public static javax.swing.JPanel createHPanel(javax.swing.JPanel panel,
                                              java.awt.Dimension spacer,
                                              java.lang.Object[]... components)
        Similar to the other createHPanel methods, however no component dimension is supplied. Instead, the components and a separate dimension for each is supplied.
        Parameters:
        panel - Panel to add this newly create panel to
        spacer - Dimension of null space between each component laid out
        components - Array of component/dimension pairs in the form [[Component 1][Dimension 1], [Component 2][Dimension 2]...etc ]
        Returns:
        The newly created JPanel

      • createVPanel

        public static javax.swing.JPanel createVPanel(javax.swing.JPanel panel,
                                              java.awt.Dimension spacer,
                                              java.lang.Object[]... components)
        Similar to the other createVPanel methods, however no component dimension is supplied. Instead, the components and a separate dimension for each is supplied.
        Parameters:
        panel - Panel to add this newly create panel to
        spacer - Dimension of null space between each component laid out
        components - Array of component/dimension pairs in the form [[Component 1][Dimension 1], [Component 2][Dimension 2]...etc ]
        Returns:
        The newly created JPanel

      • createUneditableTextField

        public static javax.swing.JTextField createUneditableTextField(java.lang.String txt)
        Convenience method for creating a text field with the given text that is uneditable - not sure why i created this instead of using labels... but i'm sure there was a reason
        Parameters:
        txt - Text to fill the text field with
        Returns:
        The created, uneditable text field
